title: San Jose International Airport
summary: Norman Y. Mineta San Jose International Airport[2] (IATA: SJC, ICAO: KSJC, FAA LID: SJC), commonly known simply as San Jose International Airport, is a city-owned public airport in San Jose, California, United States. It is named after San Jose native Norman Mineta, former U.S. Secretary of Transportation and U.S. Secretary of Commerce, who also served as Mayor of San Jose and as a San Jose City Councilman.
